attack_steps.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Python as used by the malware
attack_steps.truth: Small Sieve is a PyInstaller-packed Python script.

attack_steps.name: Boot or Logon Autostart Execution: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder as used by the malware
attack_steps.truth: Small Sieve is started by a registry run key. Once executed, the backdoor binary index.exe is installed in the userâ€™s AppData/Roaming directory and is added as a Run key in the registry to enabled persistence after reboot.

attack_steps.name: Obfuscated Files or Information as used by the malware
attack_steps.truth: Small Sieve uses a custom hex byte swapping encoding scheme combined with an obfuscated base64 function to protect program strings and updated Telegram credentials.

attack_steps.name: Execution Guardrails as used by the malware
attack_steps.truth: The Small Sieve payload will only execute correctly if the word 'Platypus' is passed to it on the command line.

attack_steps.name: Masquerading: Match Legitimate Name or Location as used by the malware
attack_steps.truth: Small Sieve uses variations of Microsoft (Microsift) and Outlook in its filenames to attempt to avoid detection during casual inspection.

attack_steps.name: Application Layer Protocol: Web Protocols as used by the malware
attack_steps.truth: Small Sieve beacons and tasking are performed using the Telegram API over HTTPS.

attack_steps.name: Data Encoding: Non-Standard Encoding as used by the malware
attack_steps.truth: Small Sieve employs a custom hex byte swapping encoding scheme to obfuscate tasking traffic.
